channel.title: [VB6] Combobox variable
channel.description:
Now i'm finally bored enough to write an app.. but now i'm stuck with the following. I know it's too easy and i know you're gonna laugh at this, but please type while laughing what i should do :P
I have a combobox called drive, and onload it adds these: [code]With drive .AddItem "D:" .AddItem "E:" .AddItem "F:" .AddItem "G:" .AddItem "H:" .AddItem "I:" .AddItem "J:" .AddItem "K:" End With[/code]
Now the user must select one of those, and then the variable 'drive' should be set to d, e, f etc etc. Do i need to create an array for this, or what else? :)
Thanks in advance! -S!ms

item.title: [VB6] Combobox variable
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Private Sub Drive_Click() SomeVar = Left(Drive.Text, 1) End Sub

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] Combobox variable
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Now i’m finally bored enough to write an app… but now i’m stuck with the following. I know it’s too easy and i know you’re gonna laugh at this, but please type while laughing what i should do

I have a combobox called drive, and onload it adds these:

With drive .AddItem "D:" .AddItem "E:" .AddItem "F:" .AddItem "G:" .AddItem "H:" .AddItem "I:" .AddItem "J:" .AddItem "K:" End With

Now the user must select one of those, and then the variable ‘drive’ should be set to d, e, f etc etc. Do i need to create an array for this, or what else?

Thanks in advance!
-S!ms
